title: Installing a minimal but full KDE Plasma on Pop!_OS 24.04 Beta
context: I wanted to install a lean but functional KDE Plasma desktop environment on Pop!_OS 24.04 Beta (Ubuntu 24.04 based) via the terminal.
keyIdea: Use the `kde-plasma-desktop` package to get core Plasma desktop without bloating full KDE apps, select `sddm` as display manager, and update/upgrade before and after.
commands:
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install kde-plasma-desktop
# select sddm when prompted
sudo reboot
# (optional) install more KDE apps:
sudo apt install kde-standard
explanation: Updating ensures your system basis (Pop!_OS) is current. Installing `kde-plasma-desktop` adds the Plasma environment and core utilities but avoids the full suite of KDE applications (like complete office, media etc). `sddm` is KDE’s preferred session/login manager. Rebooting allows you to select the Plasma session in login and start using KDE.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Use when you are on an Ubuntu derivative (or Pop!_OS) and want to switch to KDE without full app suite.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Installing desktops can lead to duplicated apps, possible theme/setting conflicts — be aware when switching between DEs. On Beta releases or non‑standard hardware (e.g., NVIDIA GPUs) check driver and session (Wayland vs X11) compatibility.
